Contingency Switch

Contingency Switch functionality makes Resilience and contingency plan in DNS very easy.

Contingency Switch functionality defines services which can be switched to one of a number of modes (LIVE, CONTINGENCY, RESILIENCE and More depending on the service requirements). Switch can be made instantly or can be scheduled easily in the TCPWave IPAM.

Services are polled to ensure the state in DNS matches that of associated selected mode.

The components of Contingency Switch are as follows:

  • Service Mode

  • Services

Service Modes

A service mode defines state of a contingency switch service in the TCPWave IPAM. A service mode can be associated to a contingency switch service along with a target resource record. NORMAL, CONTINGENCY, RESILIENCE and LIVE are the default service mode which cannot be updated and deleted. Whenever a service is created, NORMAL mode is associated without a target resource record.

Service Mode grid displays the following columns:

  • Icon: Displays the icon of the Service Mode.

  • Mode: Displays the mode of the Service Mode Attribute.

  • Description: Displays the description of the Mode.

  • Created By: Displays the name of the Admin who created the Service Mode.

  • Created Time: Displays the created date and time of the Service Mode.

  • Updated By: Displays the name of the Admin who updated the Service Mode.

  • Updated Time: Displays the date and time when the Service Mode is updated.

To Edit/Delete/Add Bookmark

  • Select the required Service mode.

  • Right click on the Service Mode

Context Menu appears.

  • Select the option (Edit/Delete/Add Bookmark) to perform the action.

Services

A contingency switch service defines DNS state of a CNAME resource record in the TCPWave IPAM. Service modes are associated to the services along with their target FQDN/IPv4/IPv6. A service can have multiple service modes but associated with a single mode at a time as selected mode. Whenever a service is created, by default NORMAL mode is associated without a target resource record as selected mode. After creating a service user can switch the service to any defined mode. A Contingency Service Poller runs every 10 minutes to check the current status and update the current mode of the service. If service is not in same mode as selected, Poller will make CNAME points to selected target mode and update the DNS.

To Edit/Delete/Show Current Status/Dig CNAME/Add Bookmark

  • Select the required Service.

  • Right click on the Service.

Context Menu appears.

  • Select the option (Edit/Delete/Show Current Status/Dig CNAME/Add Bookmark) to perform the action.

Contingency Service Poller

This is a schedule job which runs every 10 minutes and iterates over each service and if the service is not in NORMAL mode, it checks the associated CNAME’s current status in the DNS. Then it updates the Current Status and Last check fields of the service. If CNAME points to some other target which is not defined in the service, then Current Status fields will be set as empty and Last update status filed will be updated.

Global Options

Contingency Switch Functionality include two Global Options in the IPAM:

  • Enable Auto Switch Contingency: By default, set to No

  • Auto Switch Contingency Interval: Time interval in seconds

If 1st global option is set to Yes, a schedule process called AutoSwitchContingenyModeHandler will start at an interval defined in 2nd global option. AutoSwitchContingenyModeHandler iterates over all the services. If any service is in CONTINGENCY mode and it has LIVE mode defined, AutoSwitchContingenyModeHandler will ping check the Live target. If the target is alive, it will switch back the service to LIVE mode.

Reports

Overview

TCPWave Automation Manager includes built-in reporting to help local administrators understand who is making which requests or approvals on the workflow portal. This not only helps audit the system, but also allows the local administrators to determine which requests are most common in their area, giving them the intelligence, they need to fine-tune processes and optimize turnaround times.

TCPWave IPAM provides an extensive reporting functionality, which provides accurate forensics for IPv4 and IPv6 Audit, subnet audit, network audit, object audit, DNS audit reports, DHCP audit reports, Monitoring audit reports, RPZ audit report, IPv4/IPv6 utilization report, Admin audit report etc. User can customize the auditing policies to audit what the Security team is interested in for better audit reviewing.

The Login audit enables detection of unauthorized intrusions into the system. A combination of failure and success authentication audits help determine when the breach of security occurred. Isolation and preservation of the security events logs help track users who gained unauthorized admin privileges. The preservation of logs also avoids login failure logs to be overwritten through Denial of Service Attacks.

Adhoc Admin audit report generates the changes done by a selected Admin/Admin Role for the given date range. This report displays the old data along with the new modified data.

NOTE: All the changes performed by the admin will take maximum 1 minute to populate in the Adhoc Admin Audit report and other reports grid as the data is inserted in bulk into the history tables.

The following section describes in detail about each report.

DNS Reports

DNS Zone Audit

The Zone Audit Report provides complete audit information regarding operations performed on a specific Zone by an administrator. The audit information includes the Zone details and the type of action performed on it along with the name of the administrator who performed the action. The Zone audit report can be obtained from the DNS reports page in the IPAM by any administrator with appropriate privileges. The IPAM retrieves and displays the zone audit information from a specified time period provided by the user.

The Audit Report displays multiple rows of information consisting of the following fields:

SL.

Field Name

Description

Date

Displays the date of action performed

Time

Displays the time of action performed

Login Name

Displays the login name of the admin

Zone Name

Displays the name of DNS zone

Action

Displays the action performed

Status

Displays the status of the network

Active From

Displays the date and time in which the network is active

Active To

Displays the date and time up to which the network was active

Message

Displays the message of the action performed

Description

Displays the description of the network



The audit information with the above data fields is provided to the user in the forms namely.

  • Web UI Preview

  • PDF

  • CSV

  • Excel

Procedure to generate the Zone Audit Report:

In order to generate the report, the user must select the following information in the Zone Audit Report view.

Organization: Select an organization from the drop down. By selecting the organization from the drop down, it will list the active zones present in the selected organization.

Zone Status: It takes Active/Deleted

Zones: Select All/zone name from the drop down. All option generates the data of all the zones. The list of zones include root zone and proxy root zone.

From Date

To Date

After selecting the above set of information, the user must click the Generate button to generate the report. The retrieved information is displayed in the bottom section of the Report view as a preview. That displayed information will be in a tabular format with Server-side pagination enabled.

The user has the choice to choose between a PDF or CSV or Excel file format to download the generated audit report. User can generate the PDF/CSV/Excel report for all entries by selecting All option from the page length drop down in report grid. To download the audit reports the user can do one of the following steps

  • PDF Report: The user must click the PDF button to download the generated report in a PDF file format.

  • CSV Report: The user must click the CSV button to download the generated report in a CSV file format.

  • Excel Report: The user must click the Excel button to download the generated report in Excel file format.

Procedure to generate DNS Domain Query Trend report:


In order to generate the report, the user must enter the following information in the Report view.

  1. Domain: Enter a specific domain name or it generates the report for All Domains

  2. Client IP: Enter a specific client IP. If not entered, it will generate the report for all client IPs

  3. Record Type: Select All Record Types or any specific record type from the drop down

  4. From Date

  5. To Date

After selecting the above set of information, the user must click the Generate button to generate the report. The retrieved information is displayed in the bottom section of the Report view as a preview. That displayed information will be in a tabular format with Server-side pagination enabled.

The user has the choice to choose between a PDF or CSV or Excel file format to download the generated audit report. User can generate the PDF/CSV/Excel report for all entries by selecting All option from the page length drop down in report grid. To download the audit reports the user can do one of the following steps

  • PDF Report: The user must click the PDF button to download the generated report in a PDF file format.

  • CSV Report: The user must click the CSV button to download the generated report in a CSV file format.

  • Excel Report: The user must click the Excel button to download the generated report in Excel file format.

Procedure to generate Mirrored Zones Audit report:

In order to generate the report, the user must select the following information in the Mirrored Zones Audit Report view.

  1. Organization: Select an organization from the drop down. After selecting the organization from the drop down, active zones present in the selected organization will be rendered in Zones drop down.

  2. Zone Status: It takes Active/Deleted as input.

  3. Zones: Select All/zone name from the drop down. All option generates the data of all the zones.

  4. From Date: Select a date.

  5. To Date: Select a date.

After providing the information, the user must click the Generate button to generate the report. The retrieved information is displayed in the bottom section of the report view as a preview. The displayed information will be in a tabular format with server side pagination enabled.

The user has the choice to choose between a PDF or CSV or Excel file format to download the generated audit report. OFAC DNS Query Report

A list of blacklisted countries is known as OFAC countries. User can add OFAC countries list from Network Management -> DNS Management -> DNS Security -> Export Compliance Management page. Please refer to section Export Compliance Management for more information. After adding the OFAC country, user needs to perform a DNS full sync on Cache Appliance. When user performs dig for the OFAC names (northkorea.nk) listed in the Export Compliance Management page, user will not get any answer and these records are displayed in OFAC DNS Query report after 5 minutes.

This report displays multiple rows of information consisting of the following fields:



SL.

Field Name

Description

1.

Time

Displays the time at which OFAC query is performed

2.

Appliance IP

Displays IP Address of Appliance

3.

Appliance Name

Displays Appliance Name

4.

ClientIP

Displays the IP Address of Client

5.

Client Name

Displays Client name

6.

OFAC Query

Displays the OFAC query



The audit information with the above data fields is provided to the user in the forms namely.

  • Web UI Preview

  • PDF

  • CSV

  • Excel

Procedure to generate OFAC DNS Query report:

In this report, user needs to upload a CSV file that contains TLDs (like .sk for south Korea and. nk for North Korea). User can upload this file from Network Management -> DNS Management -> DNS Security -> Export Compliance Management page and click Upload button. The data in the input file is displayed on the grid and it can also be exported to CSV. Then the user needs to perform a DNS full sync on Cache Appliance. When user performs dig for the OFAC names (southkorea.sk) listed in the CSV file, user will not get any answer and these records are displayed in OFAC DNS Query report.

The retrieved information is displayed in the bottom section of the Report view as a preview. That displayed information will be in a tabular format with Server-side pagination enabled.

The user has the choice to choose between a PDF or CSV or Excel file format to download the generated audit report. User can generate the PDF/CSV/Excel report for all entries by selecting All option from the page length drop down in report grid. To download the audit reports the user can do one of the following steps

  • PDF Report: The user must click the PDF button to download the generated report in a PDF file format.

  • CSV Report: The user must click the CSV button to download the generated report in a CSV file format.

  • Excel Report: The user must click the Excel button to download the generated report in Excel file format.

Sorting and Filtering in Reports

Sorting and filtering are implemented in all the reports except Top 20 Updated IPv4 Networks and Top 20 Updated IPv6 Networks because these reports display only 20 rows of data. Sorting and filtering are supported in the grid data displayed when a report is generated. User can click the arrow symbol on the respective columns for the data to sort ascending or descending. To filter the column, enter the string to search in the search filter.

Send Report via Email

To send the generated report via email to any contacts in the IPAM, the user must click the Send Email button. This will open the Email Report dialog window.

The Email Report dialog is divided into two vertical section. The left section contains the list of contacts and the right section displays the selected contacts from the left section. User can select any number of contacts from the contacts list and then click Send Email button to immediately send the email. Click on Cancel Email button to abort the send email operation.

Schedule Sending Report via Email

To schedule the sending of generated report via email to any contacts in the IPAM, the user must click the Send Email button. This will open the Email Report dialog window.

The Email Report dialog is divided into two vertical section. The left section contains the list of contacts and the right section displays the selected contacts from the left section. User can select any number of contacts from the contacts list and then click Schedule Email button. Now, the Schedule dialog screen is displayed. Here, user must select the Date and enter the Schedule Operation time and click OK. After doing this, the schedule information is saved in the IPAM and the job will be executed at the user given time (GMT).

Common Grid Functionality

Bookmark

Using this button, user can Bookmark a row from the respective grid, for easier accessibility. User can find the added bookmarks in the Bookmark section.

User can edit and delete an object which has been bookmarked. The bookmarked section shows all the components that have been bookmarked.

The components like DNS Appliances, Zones, Domains, Address spaces, DHCP Appliances etc can be bookmarked.

User can delete a component that has been bookmarked by clicking on the Delete icon present beside the component. User can delete all the bookmarked components by clicking the Delete icon present beside the bookmark heading.

IPAM has a global policy called Maximum Allowed Bookmarks. It has a default value of 100, minimum value is 0 and maximum value is 1000.User can select a value for maximum bookmarks that can be added to the IPAM.

For example, if the user wants to bookmark a zone “example.com”, he has to navigate to DNS Managed Zone page. Select the zone i.e. example.com. Click on the bookmark button present on the top of the grid.

User will get a message saying, Bookmark has been added successfully. User can view the component he bookmarked on the left panel under the Zone section of the Bookmarks.

Import

Using this button, user can import data from a CSV File to the respective grid.

Refresh

Using this button, user can refresh the respective grid.

Column Visibility

Using this button, user can hide and show the columns present in the respective grid.

Reset Column Order

Using this button, user can reset the column order for the respective grid.

Export Data

Using this option, user can export the data present in the respective grid to PDF OR Excel or CSV Format. User can copy the data present in the grid to the clipboard and also print the data present in the grid.
